title: A Few Fun & Creative Ways to Prepare Eggs
author: Chino Valley Ranchers
content:
If breakfast has become bland and unexciting, then it’s time to inject some creativity into the first meal of the day. Say goodbye to boring omelettes and wraps, and say hello to these eye-raising egg recipes.

  1. Waffle Iron Omelets

It might be called a “waffle” iron, but with just a few ingredients you could turn it into an egg waffle iron. Simply make your usual omelet batter and pour it into a preheated and oiled waffle iron. Add fillings and do give in to the tempting aromas. Designed to be simple, the waffle iron omelet can easily be made by your kiddos.

  1. Banana Eggs

If you’re the quirky type, then banana eggs may be the perfect kind of weird — and tasty — your breakfast needs. All you need to do is combine two Chino Valley Ranchers pasture-raised eggs and one mashed banana and fry in a frying pan. Serve with fruit or whipped cream!

  1. Whole Wheat Dutch Baby

Also known as German oven pancakes, Dutch Babies are made with whole wheat flour, vanilla, a few eggs, maple syrup, milk, butter, cinnamon, powdered sugar, fresh berries, and salt. You’ll need a stainless steel skillet or cast-iron skillet to bake this baby pancake!

View the full recipe here.

  1. Instant Pot Egg Biryani

To make this tasty Indian dish, you’ll need basmati rice, eggs, ghee, yellow onions, cumin seeds, black peppercorns, bay leaves, red chili powder, turmeric, salt, garam masala, plain yogurt, ginger, garlic, water, cilantro leaves, mint leaves, tomato, milk, lemon, red onion, tomato, and sugar. If you get through gathering all of the ingredients, you can breathe a sigh of relief — your instant pot will take care of the rest of the cooking!

View the full recipe here.

  1. Vanilla Egg Protein Custards

Every now and then, it doesn’t hurt to enjoy some dessert for breakfast — as long as it also includes some protein. The vanilla egg custards look fancy, but are easy to make.

View the full recipe here.

  1. Egg-in-a-hole

Kids and adults will enjoy the creativity and flavors of this fun recipe. You’ll need whole wheat bread, eggs, softened butter, and salt and pepper to taste. You could also top with sliced avocado for some more healthy fats.

View the full recipe here.

  1. Egg Muffins

Nope, you don’t need McDonalds to enjoy some yummy egg muffins. You’ll need one dozen Chino Valley Ranchers pasture raised eggs, nonfat milk, fresh spinach, cherry tomatoes, onions, avocado, salsa, and crumbled cheese.

View the full recipe here.
excerpt: If breakfast has become bland and unexciting, then it’s time to inject some creativity into the first meal of the day. Say goodbye to boring omelettes and wraps, and say hello to these eye-raising egg recipes.
